snippet: The director David Ayer’s film “End of Watch” continues his exploration of police officers in the Los Angeles neighborhood where he grew up.
abstract: Director David Ayer, who has shot several movies about the crime-ridden South Central neighborhood of Los Angeles where he grew up, continues his exploration in his latest cop drama End of Watch. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES -- Turning left, David Ayer swings his black Lexus up Martin Luther King Boulevard, through the battered area that used to be known as South Central. One side is lined with the alleys and ratty bungalows in which, last July, Mr. Ayer shot a movie about the underside of Los Angeles -- his third such effort as a director -- called ''End of Watch.'' On the other side is a liquor store, where, he mentions, his wife and her sister used to work and where the sister was robbed at gunpoint.

headline.main: Cops Under the Palms: A Director's Obsession
